definition: familiar/close
cooked (of food)/ripe (of fruit)/mature (of seeds)/familiar/skilled/done/also pr. [shou2]
small net
net-like object/to hold sth in place with a net/to wind/to twist/(TCM) channels in the human body

sentences.english: We get acquainted with each other soon.
Yes, I know her very well. She was my girl friend during my first year in university.
sentences.chinese: 是，我跟她很熟络，她是我大学一年级时的女友。

sentences.english: I've actually become quite friendly with her.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我们很快便开始熟络和友好起来。

sentences.english: Don't assume familiarity with the reader.
sentences.chinese: 不要假设你跟读者很熟络。

definition: intimate/friendly/warm/active/lively (interaction, participation etc)
to get familiar with
to be well acquainted with/to know well
to chat
entertaining in conversation
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
gradually/little by little/in the course of time
nodding acquaintance
to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
quite familiar with sth
to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
to merge/to integrate/to become as one/to unify together
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
reserved/overcautious
